front.title: Mandatory Features of Virtual Circuit Connectivity Verification Implementations

abstract.t: RFC 5085 defines several Control Channel (CC) Types for Virtual Circuit Connectivity Verification, none of which are preferred or mandatory. As a result, independent implementations of different subsets of the three options have resulted in interoperability challenges. To enable interoperability between implementations, this document defines a subset of control channels that is considered mandatory for VCCV implementation. This will ensure that VCCV remains the valuable tool it was designed to be in multi-vendor, multi-implementation and multi-carrier networks.
